entry.title: Riley Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on her first trip abroad, Riley Jackson (pictured) won the Golden Ball as the best player of the 2022 CONCACAF Women's U-17 Championship?

entry.title: algebra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the word algebra is derived from an Arabic term for the surgical treatment of bonesetting?

entry.title: Jo Clifford (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Gospel According to Jesus, Queen of Heaven, Jo Clifford's 2009 play featuring Jesus as a trans woman, was called an "offensive abuse of Christian beliefs" by Archbishop Mario Conti?

entry.title: Illieston House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Illieston House, a castle built around 1600, was sold for £890,000 in 2019?

entry.title: Karl Loewenstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that shortly after being liberated from the Theresienstadt Ghetto in 1945, Holocaust survivor Karl Loewenstein was sent to Pankrác Prison?

entry.title: 3:16 game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 3:16 game, Tim Tebow threw for 316 yards with 31.6 yards per completion, the ratings for the game were 31.6, and the opposing team's time of possession was 31 minutes 6 seconds?

entry.title: al-Rushati (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the historian al-Rushati was martyred during the fall of Almería in 1147?

entry.title: Eriopis connexa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that female Eriopis connexa beetles prevent sibling cannibalism by laying unfertilized eggs?

entry.title: Adolf Ulrik Schützercrantz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Adolf Ulrik Schützercrantz was enrolled in the military at the age of ten?
